acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by Nahum Lewis in January 2003.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Nahum H. Lewis was born in Albany, New York in 1917. Lewis received his bachelor's and master's degrees from the State Teacher's College in Albany, New York. Lewis belonged to a variety of civil boards and was an active member of the Albany Jewish Community Center. Lewis founded the Bearing Distributors in 1946, where he worked until his retirement in 1991. Lewis died on November 22, 2003 and was survived by his wife, children, and grandchildren

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the Jewish community in New York's Capital Region and includes material from the Troy Zionist Organization of America, the Albany Jewish Community Center, the Troy Hebrew Credit Union, and an exhibit produced by the Albany Institute of History and Art.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
